intro: Corydalis pseudotongolensis, commonly known as the Tongol corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant has slender, creeping stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
